[Government](https://www.gptx.org/Government)/Mayor and City Council

Mayor and City Council
======================

![Grand Prairie City Council](https://www.gptx.org/files/assets/public/v/1/city-council-photos/city-council-group-photo-2024-optimized.jpg)

Our City Government
-------------------

The city of Grand Prairie is a Home Rule City and is governed by the laws of the State of Texas and within the framework of the City Charter which was approved by the voters of Grand Prairie on May 1, 1948. Amendments to the Charter have been approved periodically by the voters of the city. The city operates under a Council-Manager form of government which combines strong leadership, representative democracy through elected officials, and a professionally trained and educated city manager.

The City Council is the legislative body; its members are the community's decision makers. Power is centralized in the elected council, which approves the budget and determines the tax rate, for example. The council also focuses on the community's goals, major projects, and such long-term considerations as community growth, land use development, capital improvement plans, capital financing, and strategic planning. The council also supervises the city manager's performance.

* [Council District Map](https://www.gptx.org/Government/Mayor-and-City-Council/Council-District-Map)
* [City Council Meetings](https://www.gptx.org/Government/Mayor-and-City-Council/City-Council-Meetings)
* [Elections](https://www.gptx.org/Government/Mayor-and-City-Council/Elections)
* [Conflict Disclosures](https://www.gptx.org/Government/Mayor-and-City-Council/Conflict-Disclosures)

City Council Goals
------------------

(show below)

Download a copy of the [City Council Goals(PDF,3MB)](https://www.gptx.org/files/sharedassets/public/v/3/government/documents/2025-city-council-goals.pdf "City Council Top 10 Priorities and Goals").

You don't have a PDF plugin, but you can [download the PDF file.(PDF,3MB)](https://www.gptx.org/files/sharedassets/public/v/3/government/documents/2025-city-council-goals.pdf)

Committees
----------

[Council Development Committee
-----------------------------

The Council Development Committee hears items from city staff on current, future and proposed construction, economic development, Planning and Zoning items and new business.](https://www.gptx.org/Government/Mayor-and-City-Council/Council-Development-Committee)

[Council Finance and Government Committee
----------------------------------------

The Council Finance and Government Committee hears items from city staff on city budget and finance, bond and capital projects, city policies and ordinances and directional changes.](https://www.gptx.org/Government/Mayor-and-City-Council/Council-Finance-and-Government-Committee)

[Council Public Safety, Health and Environment Committee
-------------------------------------------------------

The Council Public Safety, Health and Environment Committee hears items from city staff on police, fire, public safety, ambulance, emergency management, environmental services and public health.](https://www.gptx.org/Government/Mayor-and-City-Council/Council-Public-Safety-Health-and-Environment-Committee)

[Contact City Council Members](https://www.gptx.org/Government/Mayor-and-City-Council/Contact-Your-Council-Member)

Contact City Council Members
----------------------------

Send a message to your council member online. Check the [Grand Prairie City Council District Map](https://www.gptx.org/Government/Mayor-and-City-Council/Council-District-Map) for more information.
